intro: Phaca myriophylla, commonly known as the many-leafed phaca, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel species. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically pollinated by insects. Phaca myriophylla thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
